comments:
BIOL 407, Cancer Cell Biology, has a prerequisite of BIOL 202 and 221. This course will focus on the molecular mechanisms by which fundamental cellular processes are disrupted in the development of cancer.

Students generally liked BIOL 407, with multiple students describing it as one of the best courses at Penn. Students highly recommended the class to all science majors, with one student saying that “every pre-med should take [BIOL 407].”

Professor Keith was unanimously hailed as a “great professor,” who does a “great job of breaking down information.” Students felt that Professor Keith was “very knowledgeable,” with an “extremely relatable teaching style.” This “excellent and stimulating lecturer” always avails himself to addressing problems during and outside of office hours. 

While the material in BIOL 407 can be difficult, most students felt that the work was manageable. There are weekly assignments and readings, and the lectures were described as “packed” with information.
